The researcher concludes that the medication effectively halts Alzheimer's symptom progression. What is required to convert this study into a true experimental design?

options.a: Randomly assign Alzheimer’s patients to either the medication or control groups.
options.b: Enlist a control group of 17 participants with cognitive impairments from head trauma to compare the therapeutic effects of the medication across these groups.
options.c: Conduct multiple assessments of cognitive functioning throughout the six months, including a baseline measurement before administering the medication.
options.d: Include participants with varying severity of Alzheimer’s symptoms to demonstrate that the medication benefits those with milder symptoms but not those with more severe symptoms.
options.e: Conduct a t-test to demonstrate that the medication group shows superior performance compared to the control group.
